The one step that the White House has taken so far is to address bump stocks.
That's an accessory that makes a semi-automatic weapon perform more like a machine gun.
It was not used in the Parkland, Fla., shooting, but it was used in the shooting in Las Vegas last October.
And the White House has directed the department of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms to crack down on that.
